titles.title: A bill to amend the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to require candidates for Federal office to be clearly identified in their radio and television advertisements, in accordance with regulations prescribed by the Federal Election Commission.

action.text: Referred to House Committee on House Administration.

bill.summary: 10/7/1987--Introduced. Amends the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to require: (1) any radio advertisement of a candidate for Federal office to contain the voice of the candidate identifying the candidate by name and political party; and (2) any television advertisement of a candidate to contain a picture of the candidate and the voice of the candidate identifying the candidate by name and political party.
